Core inflation, which excludes more-volatile food and energy prices, was also lower than expected, rising just 0.3% from September and 6.3% over the last year.

title: Netflix and Disney Might Be Launching Ad-Supported Tiers at the Exact Wrong Time
description: It's a difficult time to be in the digital advertising business.  Big-name companies like Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) and Alphabet's (NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) Google are showing signs of slowing ad sales, while video ad specialists like Roku (NASDAQ: ROKU) gave a dismal outlook for this year's fourth quarter.  Netflix launched its new Basic with Ads tier earlier this month, and Disney will launch its ad-supported Disney+ tier at the start of December.
